properties.headline: Rip Current Statement issued February 10 at 6:09PM AST until February 12 at 6:00AM AST by NWS San Juan PR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Dangerous rip currents.

* WHERE...for Cramer Park at St Croix.

* WHEN...From Tuesday evening through late Tuesday night.

* IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away
from shore into deeper water.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Beach goers can expect a moderate risk of
rip current until Tuesday evening when once more time the risk
will increase to high in Cramer Park.
properties.instruction:
Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and
float. Don't swim against the current. If able, swim in a
direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the
shore and call or wave for help.

NWSheadline: HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT
